alert.note: Alert for Custer (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 16 at 10:35AM MDT until June 19 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Montana... Yellowstone River at Miles City affecting Custer County. .The flood waters moving through the Yellowstone River are now expected to begin impacting Custer County and the Miles City area by Friday morning. This is a little later than earlier expected. Areas along the Yellowstone River can expect minor flooding, especially low lying areas immediate to the river. For the Yellowstone River...including Miles City...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO MIDNIGHT SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yellowstone River at Miles City. * WHEN...From Friday morning to midnight Sunday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM MDT Thursday the stage was 12.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage around midday Friday and to a crest of 15.0 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.7 feet on 05/24/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Yellowstone River Miles City 14.0 12.2 Thu 9 am 13.9 14.7 10.9 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: https://water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Friday afternoon at 1215 PM MDT.
